- The PSA-Affiliated Global Gratitude Project is seeking collaborators. More information can be found in this flyer (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1bnjI7w9OmP7WggdSx302dC-FJGPFUjK3asrZs3UDB18/edit?usp=sharing) .

Seeking collaborators for the Global Gratitude Project (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1bnjI7w9OmP7WggdSx302dC-FJGPFUjK3asrZs3UDB18/edit?usp=sharing)
With funding from the John Templeton Foundation (https://www.templeton.org/news/is-gratitude-universal) , Shige Oishi, Nicholas Coles, and Michael McCullough are seeking potential collaborators for a PSA-Affiliated cross-cultural examination of online, 30-minute, single-session gratitude interventions on subjective well-being. This will include both (1) standardized gratitude interventions traditionally developed and validated in WEIRD samples, and (2) localized (e.g., culturally tailored) gratitude interventions that collaborators might design if they so choose.

More information can be found in this flyer (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1bnjI7w9OmP7WggdSx302dC-FJGPFUjK3asrZs3UDB18/edit?usp=sharing) , and potential collaborators can express interesting using this form (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSd5vc37gpw1tvTfdrPgADDkvXv9caD4L-eQ66deUL0UsMcrPA/viewform) .

Reminder: Special call for studies on John Templeton Foundation strategic priorities (https://psysciacc.org/news/2022-12-06_second-special-call-for-studies-studying-generalizability-with-global-samples.html)

The PSA, supported by the John Templeton Foundation (JTF), welcomes study proposals to test the generalizability of phenomena related to JTF strategic priorities with large, global samples. Optional initial proposals are due by February 15 and required full proposals are due by May 15.

Please see the official call announcement (https://psysciacc.org/news/2022-12-06_second-special-call-for-studies-studying-generalizability-with-global-samples.html) for details about proposal requirements, grant support, and the project selection process and timeline.


End of year financial report (https://opencollective.com/psysciacc/updates/2022-end-of-year-update)

A copy of the PSA's end of year financial report is publicly available available here (https://opencollective.com/psysciacc/updates/2022-end-of-year-update). This report provides information about (a) the financial infrastructure we developed this year, (b) a selective list of 2022 accomplishments, and (c) some ideas for what 2023 might look like.
